3.4 Executing programs

3.4.1 Starting applications up from within Harlequin Dylan

An application written in Dylan cannot be started and later connected to Harlequin Dylan and its project. If you want to be able to debug an application and browse its compiler database within Harlequin Dylan, you must start it up by opening its project and starting it with Application > Start. This starts the application up under the debugger, providing the development environment with a connection to the application and the capabilities necessary to control its execution and to interact with it.
